page.title: 02WESTBURY PARISH CHURCH
page.content: Westbury All Saints Church was completed around the year 1340 with a Saxon and a Norman church existing on the site prior to this. There is a fine tower with walls four feet thick, inside which are the 107 steps which lead to the roof. In the tower are the third heaviest set of bells in the world, which are set on three separate axes in order to prevent the tower from collapsing when they are rung. The chimes are regulated by the 281- year- old clock, which is maintained daily by Mr.Bradley, a local train driver. Above the South Porch is carved a sundial dating from 1821. It is one of the largest in the country and has an inscription which reads: "Like to the Hour of the Day, our Time and Life soon pass away."
